page.about.introduction: my name is Tim, a software developer from northern Germany. I started working in a tax office, broke up dual studies as a sales man and found true passion in programming and especially web / infrastructure development @otto and @stadtwerk gefunden.

page.settings.identifiers.title: Your information
page.settings.identifiers.description1: Here you will find your personal ID. To be able to access your interim results from other devices, you must copy this ID and enter it on the other device.
page.settings.identifiers.description2: Please note that this ID is only intended for you. If you pass it on to others, they can change your intermediate scores!
page.settings.onlinePersistence.snackbar: New connection for the name '{{identifierName}}' created.
No connection found for the name '{{identifierName}}'.
page.settings.onlinePersistence.title: Online persistence
page.settings.onlinePersistence.descript: This website contains several functions that allow you to save intermediate scores. You can save your created folders and links in Memorandum and your high score in Catch-Em-All. As soon as you have created a connection here, you can access it from any other device. If the connection is active, you will see 'online üåê' under the name of the application in the header of every tilloh.dev page.
Simply copy your personal ID from the
on another device. Your data will then be synchronized.
page.settings.onlinePersistence.activate: Save intermediate scores on the server?
page.settings.onlinePersistence.editConn: Here you can set or change your name for online persistence of intermediate results.
page.settings.onlinePersistence.loadConn: Copy your ID and paste it on another device to synchronize your intermediate statuses.

page.todos.sideMenu.description: Shopping, tasks and much more. Create your own lists and manage your todos. üìù
page.todos.sideMenu.persistenceInfo: Created lists are saved in the browser on your device. Soon there will also be an option to save lists online and share them with others and edit them live!

page.unoSort.title: Sorting rules
page.unoSort.rules:
1. color cards are sorted according to the number in your hand, the color with the fewest cards is on the far left.
2. color cards are sorted in ascending order within the color according to their value.
3. colors with the same number of cards are sorted according to their total value.
4. black cards are always held on the far right.
